definition: An introduction at the beginning of a book, usually written by the author, explaining the purpose or context of the book.
example: The preface of the novel explained why the author chose to write about his childhood.

definition: A phrase used to show that one action causes another or is connected to another.
example: She studied hard for her exams and, in doing so, improved her grades significantly.

definition: Intentionally; done on purpose rather than by accident.
example: He deliberately left the meeting early to avoid answering difficult questions.

definition: Voluntarily; because someone has decided to, not because they were forced.
example: She lives in the countryside by choice, even though the city offers more opportunities.

definition: Automatically; happening because no alternative was chosen.
example: He became the team leader by default because no one else volunteered.

definition: To extract the essential meaning or most important part of something.
example: The teacher tried to distill the complex theory into a few simple points.

definition: To begin doing something, usually with a plan or purpose.
example: She set about organizing her notes for the big presentation.

definition: To collect information or items from various sources and put them together.
example: He compiled a list of the best restaurants in the city for his blog.

definition: Sincere and deeply felt; showing genuine emotion.
example: She gave a heartfelt speech thanking everyone for their support.

definition: With strong optimism or expectation that something good will happen.
example: He wrote the letter in the high hope that it would reach the right person.

definition: To take action based on advice, information, or knowledge.
example: If you want to improve your health, you must act on the doctor’s recommendations.

definition: A test, challenge, or difficult experience.
example: She faced many trials before finally achieving her dream of becoming a doctor.

definition: To improve or enhance the quality, value, or meaning of something.
example: Traveling can enrich your understanding of different cultures.

definition: Success, wealth, or good fortune, often both financial and personal.
example: Hard work and determination can lead to prosperity in life.

definition: To feel or show great joy or happiness.
example: When she received the award, she could not help but rejoice with her friends.

definition: A weapon that is launched and can travel through the air to hit a target, often used in military contexts.
example: The country tested a new missile that could reach targets hundreds of miles away.

definition: To locate or identify something with great accuracy.
example: Scientists were able to pinpoint the source of the earthquake.

definition: To attend an appointment, meeting, or scheduled time with someone.
example: I promised to keep a date with my teacher at 3 p.m. to discuss my project.

definition: A device that sends printed documents over a telephone line.
example: Before email became popular, the office relied on a fax machine to send contracts quickly.

definition: To have the special right or honor to do something.
example: I have the privilege to meet the president during the ceremony.

definition: To move or pass into something gradually or without notice.
example: Days slip into weeks when you are busy with work.

definition: The bed on which someone is dying; used figuratively to refer to the last moments of life.
example: On his deathbed, he told his children how much he loved them.

definition: A long, deep breath expressing relief, sadness, or tiredness.
example: She let out a sigh after finishing the difficult exam.

definition: The main or central speech at a conference or event.
example: The CEO delivered the keynote at the annual business conference.

definition: The ability to guide, direct, or inspire others.
example: Her leadership skills helped the team complete the project ahead of schedule.

definition: A deep understanding of a person, situation, or concept.
example: His book provides valuable insight into human behavior.

definition: Always; without change.
example: He invariably arrives at work before 8 a.m.

definition: To focus primarily on something.
example: The discussion centered on ways to improve education.

definition: To make something easier or less complicated.
example: We need to simplify the instructions so everyone can understand.

definition: A strong inner impulse toward a particular career or purpose in life.
example: She felt a calling to become a teacher and help children learn.

definition: Deserving respect, attention, or effort.
example: He made a worthy contribution to the charity.

definition: Having high moral qualities or ideals.
example: She pursued a noble goal of helping the poor.

definition: A goal or purpose someone aims to achieve.
example: The main objective of the project is to reduce pollution.

definition: To show or demonstrate something clearly.
example: His dedication manifested in the way he helped everyone in the team.

definition: To briefly state the main points or essence of something.
example: He tried to sum up the meeting in a few sentences.

definition: Used to say that something happens frequently, usually in a negative sense.
example: All too often, people ignore small problems until they become big issues.

definition: Impressive, large, or significant in scale or importance.
example: They stayed in a grand hotel overlooking the ocean.

definition: An achievement that requires skill, courage, or effort.
example: Climbing Mount Everest is a remarkable feat.

definition: Behavior that is morally good, polite, and considerate.
example: He showed decency by helping the elderly woman cross the street.

definition: During the duration of a period of time.
example: Over the course of the year, she learned three new languages.

definition: Sympathetic concern for the suffering or misfortune of others.
example: Volunteers showed great compassion to the victims of the flood.

definition: Polite behavior and respect toward others.
example: He thanked the driver out of courtesy.

definition: Valuable or meaningful; worth the time or effort.
example: Volunteering at the shelter was a worthwhile experience.

definition: A metaphorical cost or price that must be paid.
example: Years of stress took a toll on his health.

definition: A gift, often financial, given as a contribution, typically as a sign of gratitude or support.
example: They decided to tithe 10% of their income to charity.

definition: To routinely or habitually do something; to make a habit of doing something regularly.
example: He has a practice of sending thank-you emails after every meeting.

definition: Included inside something, usually a letter or package.
example: Please find the documents enclosed in this envelope.

definition: A prayer, expression of approval, or good wish for someone.
example: They asked for the priest’s blessing before the journey.

definition: The feeling of thankfulness or appreciation.
example: She sent a card to express her gratitude for the help she received.

definition: An action performed to       express a feeling or intention.
example: He gave her a flower as a kind gesture.

definition: To move something, usually a person in a wheelchair or a large object, into a place.
example: The patient was wheeled into the hospital room.

definition: To make someone very happy or give them great pleasure.
example: He would delight his friend with stories of the outside world.

definition: Confined to a bed because of illness or injury.
example: The bedridden man could not see outside, so he relied on his friend’s stories.

definition: A person who spends time with or stays with someone; a friend or partner.
example: His only companion in the hospital was the man next to the window.

definition: A feeling of amazement or admiration; something very surprising or beautiful.
example: The man could not see the wonders his friend described.

definition: A sudden period of repeated coughing.
example: During a coughing fit, he stopped breathing.

definition: To move someone or something out of a place using a wheeled device.
example: The dead patient was wheeled out of the room.

definition: To tell someone about something, usually a story or event.
example: He would recount the sights outside the window in detail.

definition: Something that is seen or can be seen; a view.
example: The man shared the beautiful sights of the park with his friend.

definition: To act according to a rule, request, or command.
example: The nurse complied with the patient’s request to move his bed.

definition: Being present and taking care of someone, especially in a hospital.
example: The attending nurse moved his bed next to the window.

definition: To cause someone to tremble or be very surprised or scared.
example: The view outside the window made him shake with shock.

definition: Very plain, empty, or harsh in appearance.
example: The window faced a stark brick wall, not the park.

definition: To make someone imagine or think of something, especially something that is not really there.
example: He conjured up beautiful scenes to comfort his friend.

definition: Concerned more with the needs and wishes of others than with one’s own.
example: His actions were selfless, done purely out of love.

definition: Considering the bigger picture or the entire situation.
example: In the overall scheme of things, our problems are small.

definition: A very small, temporary, or insignificant event in a larger context.
example: Our lives are just a blip on the canvas of eternity.

definition: A surface for painting; here it means the 'whole picture' of life or existence.
example: Our lives are mere blips on the canvas of eternity.

definition: Infinite or unending time.
example: Life is short, but the universe goes on for eternity.

definition: To enjoy something completely, especially an experience or moment.
example: We should savor the journey of life, not just the destination.
